item.title: Fibrowitch add a quote by John Rogers
item.description:
"There are two novels that can change a bookish fourteen-year oldâ€™s life: <i>[book:The Lord of the Rings|10254806]</i> and <i>[book:Atlas Shrugged|9365]</i>. One is a childish fantasy that often engenders a lifelong obsession with its unbelievable heroes, leading to an emotionally stunted, socially crippled adulthood, unable to deal with the real world. The other, of course, involves orcs."
[<i>Kung Fu Monkey -- Ephemera</i>, blog post, March 19, 2009]" -- John Rogers

item.title: Fibrowitch add a quote by J. R. R. Tolkien
item.description: "Nobody believes me when I say that my long book is an attempt to create a world in which a form of language agreeable to my personal aesthetic might seem real. But it is true." -- J. R. R. Tolkien

item.title: Fibrowitch add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Sam: I wonder if we'll ever be put into songs or tales. Frodo: [turns around] What? Sam: I wonder if people will ever say, 'Let's hear about Frodo and the Ring.' And they'll say 'Yes, that's one of my favorite stories. Frodo was really courageous, wasn't he, Dad?' 'Yes, my boy, the most famousest of hobbits. And that's saying a lot.' Frodo: [continue walking] You've left out one of the chief characters - Samwise the Brave. I want to hear more about Sam. [stops and turns to Sam] Frodo: Frodo wouldn't have got far without Sam. Sam: Now Mr. Frodo, you shouldn't make fun; I was being serious. Frodo: So was I. [they continue to walk] Sam: Samwise the Brave..." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Fibrowitch add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Come, Mr. Frodo!' he cried. 'I can't carry it for you, but I can carry you." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
